title: Plymouth Argyle v Barnet: One to Watch - John Akinde (Striker)
content:
IT IS one day short of seven years since John Akinde scored his first goal in the Football League – and it came against Argyle.

Then aged 19, Akinde was a half-time substitute for Bristol City in a Championship clash at Ashton Gate on September 30, 2008 and the Pilgrims were leading 2-0 after goals from Jamie Mackie and Rory Fallon.

Akinde marked his debut by reducing the deficit shortly after the hour mark and David Noble then came up with a late equaliser as the match ended 2-2.

That was the only goal Akinde scored for City, though, as he made two starts and 19 substitute appearances over three years before moving to Crawley Town in the summer of 2011.

Akinde signed for Barnet from Alfreton Town in July 2014 and scored 31 goals in 45 games as the Bees secured the Football Conference Premier title last season.
